meanings.definition: The quality or state of being importunate.
meanings.sent1: Her constant importunities for attention became tiresome.
meanings.sent2: The importunities of the salesperson finally convinced him to make a purchase.
meanings.sent3: The importunities of the puppy for treats were hard to resist.
meanings.sent4: The importunities of the storm on the fragile roof were relentless.
meanings.sent5: The importunities of the alarm clock ensured he never overslept.

meanings.definition: The act of importuning; persistent solicitation or entreaty.
meanings.sent1: He ignored the importunities of the street vendors as he walked by.
meanings.sent2: The importunities of the charity volunteers were hard to turn down.
meanings.sent3: The importunities of the squirrels for more nuts were comical.
meanings.sent4: The importunities of the waves on the shore never ceased.
meanings.sent5: The importunities of the beggar for spare change were met with kindness.
